name: Acyclovir

indications.text: acyclovir cream , 5 % herpes simplex virus ( hsv ) deoxynucleoside analogue dna polymerase inhibitor indicated treatment recurrent herpes labialis ( cold sores ) immunocompetent adults adolescents 12 years age older .

contraindications.text: acyclovir cream , 5 % applied 5 times per day 4 days . therapy initiated early possible following onset signs symptoms herpes labialis , i.e . prodrome lesions appear . adolescents 12 years age older , adults .

warningsAndPrecautions: gram acyclovir cream , contains 50 mg ( equivalent 5 % w/w ) acyclovir , usp smooth homogeneous white off-white cream . acyclovir cream , 5 % supplied follows : 5 g tubes ndc 65162-836-14 store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15° 30°c ( 59° 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] .
adverseReactions: acyclovir cream contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity acyclovir usp , valacyclovir , component formulation .
indications_original: Acyclovir cream, 5% is a herpes simplex virus (HSV) deoxynucleoside analogue DNA polymerase inhibitor indicated for the treatment of recurrent herpes labialis (cold sores) in immunocompetent adults and adolescents 12 years of age and older.
contraindications_original:
Acyclovir cream, 5% should be applied 5 times per day for 4 days. Therapy should be initiated as early as possible following the onset of signs or symptoms of herpes labialis, i.e. during the prodrome or when lesions appear. 
                  For adolescents 12 years of age and older, the dosage is the same as in adults.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Each gram of acyclovir cream, contains 50 mg (equivalent to 5% w/w) of acyclovir, USP in a smooth homogeneous white to off-white cream. Acyclovir cream, 5% is supplied as follows: 
                  
                     5 g tubes NDC 65162-836-14 
                  
                  
                     Store at or below 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
adverseReactions_original: Acyclovir cream is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to acyclovir USP, valacyclovir, or any component of the formulation.
